title: Discriminatory practices prohibition
context: §489-3 Discriminatory practices prohibition. Unfair discriminatory practices that deny, or attempt to deny, a person the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, privileges, advantages, and accommodations of a place of public accommodation on the basis of race, sex, including gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, color, religion, ancestry, or disability are prohibited. [L 1986, c 292, pt of §1; am L 1990, c 210, §2; am L 1992, c 33, §5; am L 2006, c 76, §3] Law Journals and Reviews An Analysis of Hawai`i&rsquo;s Tradition of &ldquo;Local&rdquo; Ethnic Humor. 30 UH L. Rev. 219.
